entry.title: XCode linker error
entry.content:
An old project was created for iOS 5. When trying to re-run it, I got these error messages

Do not recall this kind of trouble before with iOS upgrade.

Set the ‘Deployment Target’ to iOS6, clean and rebuilt but it did not work.

AVFoundation Framework is actually dropped out from “Link Binary with Libraries” section. Re-adding the framework fixes the issue.

entry.title: Was about to hit ‘brew install git’. Then I realised I'd already have git installed
entry.content:
Do not have git on my rebuilt MBP. Was about to hit ‘brew install git’. Then I realised: I already have git installed. It is part of XCode.

So it is what I did: add the following line to .bash_rc

entry.title: A scheme calls a number of targets
entry.content: A scheme calls a number of targets

entry.title: Error: No developer directory found at /Developer
entry.content:
Had "Error: No developer directory found at /Developer. Run /usr/bin/xcode-select to update the developer directory path" when I ran xcodebuild.

Most likely an issue left from an old xcode installation (pre 4.2)

The following command fix the problem

sudo xcode-select -switch /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer

entry.title: Command-E to quick search; Command-G for repeat in-file search
entry.content: Command-E to quick search; Command-G for repeat in-file search
